text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Sherlock: Excuse me.
Barbara: Yes, sir. Can I help you?
Sherlock: Um, this steak, I asked for to be medium rare.
Barbara: Medium rare, that's right, sir. I remember your order.
Sherlock: Well, I'm afraid it isn't. It's a bit too well done and rather tough. Would you mind changing?
Barbara: If it is not to your satisfaction, I'll certainly bring you another. But I'm afraid you may have to wait for a few minutes.
Sherlock: Yes, that's all right. Thank you very much.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
text.Response A: In the conversation, Sherlock politely informs the waitress, Barbara, that his steak is not cooked to his liking. Barbara apologizes and offers to bring him a new steak, but it may take a few minutes to prepare. Sherlock agrees to wait and thanks her for her help.
text.Response B: Sherlock asked for a medium rare steak, but it is too well done. Barbara will bring him another one.

Prompt

Conversation:
Sherlock: Excuse me.
Barbara: Yes, sir. Can I help you?
Sherlock: Um, this steak, I asked for to be medium rare.
Barbara: Medium rare, that's right, sir. I remember your order.
Sherlock: Well, I'm afraid it isn't. It's a bit too well done and rather tough. Would you mind changing?
Barbara: If it is not to your satisfaction, I'll certainly bring you another. But I'm afraid you may have to wait for a few minutes.
Sherlock: Yes, that's all right. Thank you very much.

Now write a summary of the conversation:

Response A

In the conversation, Sherlock politely informs the waitress, Barbara, that his steak is not cooked to his liking. Barbara apologizes and offers to bring him a new steak, but it may take a few minutes to prepare. Sherlock agrees to wait and thanks her for her help.

Response B

Sherlock asked for a medium rare steak, but it is too well done. Barbara will bring him another one.
